article.headline: Buffalo 72, Penn State 70
article.story: STATE COLLEGE, Pa. (AP) -- Turner Battle hit a running jumper from the left elbow as time expired to give Buffalo a 72-70 win against Penn State Tuesday. With 4.9 seconds left, Daniel Gilbert inbounded the ball at midcourt to Battle, who drove past the half-court circle, spun past Mike Walker and hit the game-winner. Calvin Cage led the Bulls (7-2) with 18 points and Mark Bortz added 15, both from the bench. Yassin Idbihi scored 12 points to lead Buffalo's starters, and Mario Jordan added 10. Penn State (5-5) trailed 66-60 with less than a minute left, but tied the game after Battle missed the first of a 1-and-1 free throw with 14.6 seconds left. Geary Claxton rebounded the ball and passed it ahead to Marlon Smith, who drove past two defenders and hit a five-foot runner from the left baseline with 5.6 seconds left. Travis Parker scored 17 points to lead the Nittany Lions, who also got 14 points from Claxton and 13 apiece from Smith and Aaron Johnson. The lead switched 13 times, although Buffalo did not trail after Cage hit a 3-pointer with 15:54 left in the game that sparked an 8-0 Buffalo run.
